properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this afternoon and tonight. Local lake effect flurries impacting highway 17 from Terrace Bay to Wawa will give additional local amounts of 5 to 10 centimetres through tonight. Visibility will be reduced at times in heavy flurries and cold temperatures combined with rapidly accumulating snow on roads may be hazardous at times. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-09T11:37:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T19:38:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2444519501.2020
Area: Marathon - Schreiber, White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm continues. Significant snowfall is expected over southern Alberta today with total accumulations of 10 to 15 cm. Snowfall will continue to taper off late this afternoon before clearing overnight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-09T04:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T20:46:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3363398954.2020
Area: M.D. of Ranchland, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Cowley Burmis and Maycroft, Piikani Reserve, Municipality of Crowsnest Pass including Coleman and Frank, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Beauvais Lake Prov. Park, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Pincher Creek and Twin Butte, Waterton Lakes Nat. Park and Blood Res. 148A, M.D. of Willow Creek near Granum and Peigan Timber Limit, M.D. of Willow Creek near Fort Macleod, Blood Res. 148 including Stand Off, Cardston Co. near Hill Spring and Glenwood, Cardston Co. near Magrath and Woolford Prov. Park, Cardston Co. near Del Bonita and Kimball, Cardston Co. near Mountain View and Beazer, Cardston Co. near Cardston and Carway
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues. The coldest wind chill values will be between minus 50 and minus 55. These very cold wind chill values are still possible for Tuktoyaktuk and Paulatuk today. Wind chill values should moderate this afternoon. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-08T23:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T17:51:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3071902114.2020
Area: Paulatuk, Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Coldest wind chills: near -45. Locations: Labrador City and Wabush and Churchill Falls. Time span: overnight tonight into early Sunday morning. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-02-09T11:43:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T19:44:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0311550700.2020
Area: Churchill Falls and vicinity, Labrador City and Wabush
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills is expected. A bitterly cold air moving southwards out of the high Arctic will bring temperatures of -35 to -40 to parts of the eastern Arctic. These temperatures will combine with light to moderate winds to produce dangerous wind chills near -55 at times through the remainder of the weekend. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-09T12:50:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T20:51:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0323996608.2020
Area: Hall Beach, Igloolik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds with severe and damaging gusts are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southwesterly 110 km/h, except 130 over exposed areas. Locations: south coast of Newfoundland. Time span: until this afternoon. Remarks: Strong southwesterly winds will begin to ease upon shifting to westerlies this afternoon. In addition, as temperatures fall below freezing today, standing water will freeze. Surfaces may become slippery. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-02-08T22:59:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T14:22:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2180434135.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southwesterly 100 km/h, except 120 over exposed areas. Locations: St. John's, the northern Avalon Peninsula, Clarenville, Terra Nova, and the Bonavista Peninsula. Time span: until this afternoon. Remarks: Strong southwesterly winds will begin to ease upon shifting to westerly late this afternoon. In addition, as temperatures begin to fall below freezing near noon today, standing water will freeze. Surfaces may become slippery. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-02-08T22:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-08T14:20:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4209671184.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova

properties.Summary:
